claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: A schematic flowchart illustrating the baculovirus–insect cell expression system for manufacturing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) vaccine (RIV4). It shows cloning the HA gene into a baculovirus vector, infecting insect cells in a bioreactor, harvesting via disc-stack centrifugation, extraction, depth filtration for clarification, chromatographic capture and purification steps including DNA removal, followed by tangential flow filtration/formulation. The figure depicts only the manufacturing process of a recombinant HA vaccine and contains no immunogenicity or cross-protection data; it does not support the claim. Note: The image is clear but focused on production steps; no data on breadth of immune response or mismatch season protection are presented.
